Repugnancy.origin: [if two acts which cover the same subject matter are repugnant…, the latter operates to the extent of the as a repeal of the former " In re Miller , 107 F. Supp. 1006 (1952)"]

1.definition: the quality or fact of being inconsistent, irreconcilable, or in disagreementa contradiction or inconsistency between sections of a legal instrument (as a contract or statute) [if two acts which cover the same subject matter are repugnant…, the latter operates to the extent of the as a repeal of the former ", 107 F. Supp. 1006 (1952)"]

2.definition: an instance of contradiction or inconsistency
